overview:
Ryan is a recent graduate with high distinction from the University of Michigan Ross School of Business, where he studied Entrepreneurship and Marketing. He was the 2012 William G. McGowan Fellow, named a Zell Entrepreneurial Scholar, and served as the Student Managing Director of Ross’s $5.5M student-run Wolverine Venture Fund, for which he received the David T. Shelby Award for Outstanding Leadership.

While at Ross, Ryan interned as a product manager with Amazon Web Services, designing a new EC2 product to improve adoption by startups. Before business school, Ryan was a Senior Associate at PRTM Management Consultants in Washington DC, where he specialized in designing and implementing strategies for innovation, technology management, and supply chain innovation. Before joining PRTM, Ryan worked as an engineer and project manager for SPAWAR, a U.S. Navy research and development center in San Diego, where he launched an innovation incubator and led several patented and patent-pending projects from conception through prototype.

Ryan earned his Master of Engineering in engineering management and a Bachelor of Science in electrical and computer engineering from Cornell University. He held top leadership positions in three prominent student organizations at Cornell and was named the 2004 Cornell Distinguished Student Volunteer of the Year.
